meanings.definition: Present (a play, ballet, or other performance) again or in a different way.
meanings.sent1: The theater group decided to restaged their popular play for the school assembly.
meanings.sent2: The director chose to restaged the classic play with a modern twist.
meanings.sent3: The actors accidentally restaged the play in reverse order, creating a hilarious mix-up.
meanings.sent4: Her memories of the past were restaged in her dreams like a vivid movie.
meanings.sent5: The way they restaged the final scene left a lasting impression on the audience.

meanings.definition: To stage (a play, ballet, or other performance) again or in a different way.
meanings.sent1: After the success of the first show, they decided to restaged it for a second run.
meanings.sent2: The dance company restaged their famous performance for the anniversary celebration.
meanings.sent3: The children wanted to restaged their school play with superhero costumes for fun.
meanings.sent4: The artist restaged the exhibition in a new gallery, attracting a different crowd.
meanings.sent5: The way they restaged the musical number brought a fresh energy to the performance.
